info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 4:58PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Meagher, southwestern Judith Basin and southeastern Cascade Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 458 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 24 miles south of Stanford, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Meagher, southwestern Judith Basin and southeastern Cascade Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
